content:
Check out the delicious segmentation model derived from a Hugo Campos remark https://twitter.com/epatientdave/status/1173632124634718211?s=21

This may be the definitive heart-and-soul essay on "Why should anyone care about interop?" @FirelyTeam @GrahameGrieve @motorcycle_guy #HL7 #FHIR #HL7WGM @S4PM #GMDD Real power in this new segmentation model - blessings again on @HugoOC for Brazilian "knife & cheese" metaphor https://twitter.com/SusannahFox/status/1173570426116562944

- Dave deBronkart (@ePatientDave)

Here's that "segmentation model." As the post describes, the legendary e-patient Hugo Campos told Susannah a Brazilian saying, "He has both the knife and the cheese" - both the tool and the resource to make something good happen.

What Susannah did with it, in this graphic, is brilliantly give form to something we've all sensed: patients aren't a homogeneous group re data access and thus interop. Some WANT to be involved, some don't, some CAN get involved (have tools/power), some don't. It's really useful when discussing social change to have this distinction.

pasted image

I'm describing it imprecisely - please read the post. Example: lower right quadrant is "has data, doesn't want tools" - that's the "pantry" that holds onto the food.... nothing gets consumed (for value) until it's OUT of the pantry. Really interesting.
Wow, I just noticed that she added a note at the end of her post, telling people to apply for our Patient Innovator track! @Rien Wertheim @Grahame Grieve take note!
